page.title: 02DRAINING THE MARSHES.
page.content: In 1626 a Dutchman called{Cornelius {Vermuyden}was given Letters of Authority by{Charles I}to drain the marshes in the Isle of Axholme, around the vicinity of Crowle. The king, Charles I, got Cornelius Vermuyden to drain the Fen Lands because he was well known in Holland for draining. He was also very successful in doing so. When Cornelius Vermuyden had drained the land he was very popular and also unpopular because of what he had done. He was popular among the very rich land owners because they wanted the land to use for farming on.The profits provided taxes for the King. He was unpopular among poorer folk because they needed the marsh land to suvive.They needed it because the food they ate lived on or in the marshes.
